types.name: DateTime
types.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

fields.name: paperPaths
fields.description: Liste de chemins vers les fichiers représentant le sujet (ou la fiche de révision)

fields.name: solutionPaths

types.name: Error
types.description: The most basic error object, based on the base JavaScript Error object.

types.name: ErrorInterface
types.description: Basic interface for all error types to implement.

types.name: Event
types.description: An event is a date, time and place, as well as an optional ticket

types.name: EventManager
types.description: An event manager is a user that can scan tickets, and may be able to manage the event

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: GodparentRequest
types.description: Requests to become someone's godchild. Gets deleted once the request has been accepted (or denied). godchild is the requester, godparent is the requested.

types.name: Group
types.description: A group is a collection of users

fields.name: ancestors
fields.description: All the ancestors of this group, from the current group to the root.

fields.name: familyId
fields.description: Helper field to get a whole tree without processing all groups\nTo be set to the group's id itself for root groups.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: Parent group, from which this group inherits its permissions

fields.name: related
fields.description: Related clubs

fields.name: root
fields.description: Family root, only created for performance reasons

types.name: GroupMember
types.description: The intermediate model between users and groups

types.name: HealthCheck
types.description: Results of a health self-check

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: acknowledgeChangelog
fields.description: Marks the user as having seen the given version's changelog.

fields.name: activateApp
fields.description: Activate a third-party app. Only admins can do this.

args.name: id
args.description: The app's ID

fields.name: authorize
fields.description:
Authorize a third-party client to access the user's data. 
Returns an access code. 

Use the frontend's /authorize endpoint instead of this, as it requires already being logged-in.

Do a `GET` request to `https://churros.inpt.fr/authorize?client_id=<clientId>&redirect_uri=<redirectUri>&response_type=code&state=<state>` with:

- `<clientId>`: The client ID of the app. See registerApp to get this.
- `<redirectUri>`: The URL that you want to redirect the user to. The frontend uses this on /authorize to redirect users to `<redirectUri>?code=<return value of this mutation>`
- `<state>`: A random string generated from personal information used to prevent CSRF attacks.

Use that code to get an access token with /token:

Do a `POST` request to `https://churros.inpt.fr/token` with a `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` body with the following fields:

- `grant_type`: `authorization_code`
- `code`: The code returned by this endpoint
- `client_id`: The client ID of the app
- `client_secret`: The client secret of the app
- `redirect_uri`: The redirect URI used in this request

args.name: clientId
args.description: The client ID of the app. See registerApp to get this.

args.name: redirectUri
args.description: The URL that you want to redirect the user to. The frontend uses this on /authorize to redirect users to `<redirectUri>?code=<return value of this mutation>`

fields.name: deactivateApp
fields.description: Deactivate a third-party app. Only admins can do this.

args.name: id
args.description: The app's ID

fields.name: deleteGodparentRequest
fields.description: Deletes a pending godparent request. If accept is true, the request will be accepted (and the godparent of the requester will be changed), otherwise it will be rejected (the godparent of the requester won't be changed)

fields.name: editApp
fields.description: Update a third-party app's details

args.name: id
args.description: The app's ID

fields.name: login
fields.description: Logs a user in and returns a session token.

fields.name: logout
fields.description: Logs a user out and invalidates the session token.

fields.name: paidRegistration
fields.description: When paying with Paypal, returns the order id for a capture to finish the payment

fields.name: registerApp
fields.description: Register a third-party OAuth2 client. Returns the client secret. The client secret cannot be retrieved at any other time. Use refreshAppSecret to rotate your client secret.

args.name: allowedRedirectUris
args.description: Allowed redirect URIs.

args.name: description
args.description: The app's description

args.name: name
args.description: The app's name

args.name: ownerGroupUid
args.description: The UID of  the group that made this app

args.name: website
args.description: URL to the website of the app. Used, amongst other things, to get the icon.

fields.name: rotateAppSecret
fields.description: Rotate a third-party app's secret

args.name: id
args.description: The app's ID

fields.name: updateRoomOpenState
fields.description: Changer si la salle d'un groupe est fermé ou ouvert

args.name: groupUid
args.description: L'uid du groupe

args.name: openRoom
args.description: Vrai si on veut indiquer que le local est maintenant ouvert

args.name: godparentUid
args.description: An empty string removes the godparent. Passing null (or undefined) does not update the godparent. An uid sets the godparent to that uid.

args.name: bannedUsers
args.description: List of user uids

args.name: coOrganizers
args.description: List of group uids

types.name: NotFoundError
types.description: An error raised when a resource does not exist.

types.name: Notification
types.description: A notification is a push notification that was sent to a user

types.name: NotificationSubscription
types.description: A NotificationSubscription stores a user's subscription to push notifications on a user agent

types.name: OAuth2ErrorCode
types.description: OAuth2 error codes, see RFC 6749 § 4.1.2.1

fields.name: allApps
fields.description: Get all OAuth2 clients. Only admins can do this.

args.name: version
args.description: The version to request a changelog for. Defaults to the current version (1.44.0).

fields.name: combinedChangelog
fields.description:
A changelog for multiple versions. 
Be careful, this range is (from, to]. I.e. **the first version is excluded, and the last is included**. 
This is way more useful for querying a range of versions for a changelog, but not the usual way ranges are defined.

args.name: from
args.description: The version to start from, **exclusive**. Leave empty to start from the latest version the user has seen

args.name: to
args.description: The version to end at, **inclusive**. Leave empty to end at the current version (1.44.0).

args.name: id

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
